DataElement.preferredName: Antimicrobial Solution Treatment Soft Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for treatment administration with antimicrobial solution to soft tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Antimicrobial Solution Treatment Soft Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to soft tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch) administered with antimicrobial solution treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A homogeneous mixture of two or more substances capable of destroying or inhibiting the growth of microorganisms.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A family of substances capable of destroying or inhibiting the growth of bacteria.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Soft; lacking in hardness relatively or comparatively.:Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Lacking in hardness relatively or comparatively.
Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
